intro: Languas malaccensis, commonly known as the Malacca lantana, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is characterized by its clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its flowers are often fragrant and attract various pollinators. Languas malaccensis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils.
